channel.title: 93 Year Old Man Freezes to Death in Home
channel.description:
BAY CITY, Mich. (Jan. 26) - A 93-year-old man froze to death inside his home just days after the municipal power company restricted his use of electricity because of unpaid bills, officials said. Marvin E. Schur died "a slow, painful death," said Kanu Virani, Oakland County's deputy chief medical examiner, who performed the autopsy.
Sauce: [url=http://news.aol.com/article/man-93-freezes-to-death-in-home/318210]http://news.aol.com/article/man-93-freezes-to-death-in-home/318210[/url] I think it was stupid to restrict his electricity. Its -40 temperatures here in Wisconsin and even worse in Michigan..and this guy is 93 years old.

item.title: 93 Year Old Man Freezes to Death in Home
item.dc:creator: @Uriko Uriko
item.description:
@Uriko wrote:

[quote=“goatee, post:11, topic:258678”]Slowly freezing to death? Maybe he should have put some more clothes on… unless he didn’t notice he was dying.

Maybe he thought because he’s so old then he was dying from old age and not the cold.[/quote]Or maybe he had a healthcare worker that wasn’t with him at the time to help him with his needs (ie. put on clothing, shower, etc.)

Read full topic

item.title: 93 Year Old Man Freezes to Death in Home
item.dc:creator: @Pwnd Pwnd
item.description:
@Pwnd wrote:

[quote=“Kane., post:8, topic:258678”][quote author=Uriko link=topic=341586.msg2643040#msg2643040 date=1233016892]

That’s horrible.
Couldn’t even call for help… Unless this hip 93 year old had a cell.

I bet the electricity company is feeling stupid now.

If the man has family left, they would most likely be going to the electricity company.

But, can they do anything? Is it a suable offence?

They just did what they are inclined to do. No payments equals no electricity.
[/quote]Yeah, but then again… it’s America, you can sue anybody to get some money pretty much.

Haha, true dat.
I wonder if they called his residence and spoke to him before they cut it off; give him some warning. If not, then it was a pretty stupid thing to do.[/quote]You basically get like… 3 late notices in the mail before anything goes down.

Read full topic
item.source: 93 Year Old Man Freezes to Death in Home

It’s likely they can be sued, don’t quote me, but it being any sort of company, there’s always some sort of flaw that is suable.
